image.altText: Glass entrance doors show a cross on the wall inside The Wesley Hospital.

props.synopsis: UnitingCare Queensland has reached a new financial agreement with Australia's largest health insurance buying group, after giving notice to end its contract last month.

title.children: Agreement reached after funding spat between private hospitals and health insurers that left policy holders 'caught in the middle'

image.altText: hand pulling condom out of pocket.

props.synopsis: New sexual consent laws come into effect from today, along with the criminalisation of stealthing.

title.children: Stealthing will be criminalised in Queensland from today. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: An RFS volunteer photographed in the smoke of a hazard reduction burn

props.synopsis: A large fire is burning in far north Queensland, while 10 local government areas in the south have been placed under a total fire ban amid heightened bushfire conditions.

title.children: Community told to prepare to evacuate as total fire ban imposed across much of southern Queensland

image.altText: An old gent in broad-brimmed hat and blue overalls leans on a messy office desk.

props.synopsis: Dick Daley has been yapping, tinkering and pumping fuel on the Atherton Tablelands for the past 60 years, at a service station he bought with the help of a 50-pound loan.

title.children: Servo owner hangs up the fuel pump at 94, offering 'driveway service' until last day on the job

image.altText: Children hands on fence

props.synopsis: The federal government has tightened its $170 million ABSTUDY funding program following allegations of abuse, fraud and neglect at one Indigenous hostel.

title.children: Indigenous student hostel closes after allegations of abuse, neglect and forced labour

image.altText: Widower's anger: Man with grey hair sits in chair and looks at camera with strong resolve.

props.synopsis: The murder of Emma Lovell was a tipping point in public sentiment about the government's handling of youth crime, which is shaping up as one of the major issues that will decide next month's state election.

title.children: Youth crime is shaping up to be a key election issue. For some Queenslanders, it's personal

image.altText: A gravesite with a sign surrounded by rocks in a sparse, outback landscape.

props.synopsis: From infants gone too young to swagmen who died in mysterious circumstances, bush graves of the forgotten are being restored by volunteers near the town of Eromanga in south-west Queensland.

title.children: Bush grave restorations 'honouring and remembering' outback locals with stories often marked by tragedy

image.altText: A young mum with brown hair taking a selfie with her young son, who has long blonde hair

props.synopsis: Children living with disability are over-represented in school suspensions and a new report has shed light on their cost to families and the broader economy.

title.children: Children with disability lose 107,000 days of education a year in Queensland due to suspensions

image.altText: An illustration of a map of Australia highlighting Queensland.

props.synopsis: From the cost of living and transport to housing and the environment, we want to know what's impacting you or your community.

title.children: Are you a first-time voter? What's one issue that would sway your opinion?

image.altText: Signs at coles and woolworths

props.synopsis: Hundreds of products were affected, the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission alleges, including family packs of Oreos and throat lozenges.

title.children: Coles and Woolworths campaigns promised cheaper prices for years. Now they're accused of 'misleading' customers on more than 500 products

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaks in the Prime Minister's Courtyard.

props.synopsis: Share prices of the big supermarkets have been hit hard on news the ACCC has hauled them into court alleging they had misled customers over hundreds of discounts, while the ASX 200 opened down 0.7pc after Wall Street's rate-cut rally came to a halt on Friday. Follow the latest on our live markets blog.

title.children: PM speaks on supermarket code as Coles and Woolworths savaged on ASX

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Coles and Woolworths hammered,  ASX down 0.7%
Weak manufacturing leads business activity contraction

image.altText: A woman leans on the wing of an RFDS plane and looks away from the camera

props.synopsis: Crippling doctor shortages have been an age-old burden in the outback, but a unique partnership hopes taking to the sky could be the solution.

title.children: How giving junior medicos wings could help ease crippling doctor shortages in the outback

image.altText: LNP leader David Crisafulli and justice spokesperson Laura Gerber (left)

props.synopsis: The LNP announces a plan to create four new early intervention schools for youth at risk of entering a life of crime. But the state government says the funding announcement doesn't add up.

title.children: LNP announces early intervention plan to stop at-risk young people becoming criminals

image.altText: Men search through rubble

props.synopsis: Chadi Fares sits on the sidewalk of a Beirut street, watching emergency workers pick their way through piles of twisted metal and slabs of collapsed concrete.

title.children: 'Everything is gone': Search for bodies after Israeli strike on Beirut residential building

image.altText: A cold glass of beer.

props.synopsis: David Littleproud faces a backlash from senior Liberals over the National Party leader's "freelancing" pledge to consider freezing beer excise under a future Coalition government.

title.children: Liberals pour cold beer on Littleproud excise freeze

image.altText: jigsaw 4

props.synopsis: Perhaps no question matters more to households worn down by cost of living pressures, but the answer is not straightforward.

title.children: The four numbers that could tell us when interest rates will go down

image.altText: New Socceroos coach Tony Popovic sits a desk and answers questions from the media.

props.synopsis: Tony Popovic has been named the new head coach of the Socceroos, taking over after the sudden resignation of Graham Arnold.

title.children: Popovic named as new Socceroos coach ahead of crucial World Cup qualifers

image.altText: A person wearing a keffiyeh holds their fingers up in a peace sign, a Palestinian flag is in the background.

props.synopsis: Among the many words spoken about Palestinians fleeing Gaza in our febrile domestic political debate about visa checks and national security, we have heard very little about the hatred — both private and at times public — that some Gazans feel about and toward Hamas.

title.children: The complicated politics of the Israel-Gaza war continue to mount in Australia

image.altText: A man, photographed from behind so his face isn't visible, looks downcast

props.synopsis: When Ezekiel landed in Australia as a guest worker two years ago, he was full of hope. Two years later, he is in limbo, destitute and homeless with the company that sponsored him being investigated for abuse and mistreatment of workers.

title.children: Crisis point in regional towns as modern slavery overwhelms local services

image.altText: Donald Trump holds up a fist. A crowd is behind him.

props.synopsis: Former president Donald Trump says that he will not make a fourth consecutive run for the US presidency if he loses the upcoming election.

title.children: 'That will be it': Trump says he will not run again if he loses in November

image.altText: Kim Jong Un speaks in front of microphones with a red and yellow flag in the background

props.synopsis: Kim Jong Un runs the 'model dictatorship' in North Korea. Here's how he got here.

title.children: 'Publicly executed to send a message': The brutal regime of Kim Jong Un

image.altText: A Brisbane Lions AFL player stands smiling at a lectern with a medal around his neck, in front of a sign saying "Chas Brownlow".

props.synopsis: The AFL's gala night of the year is nearly here, as the league's best-and-fairest player is honoured with the Brownlow Medal. Here's everything you need to know about the big event.

title.children: Everything you need to know about the 2024 Brownlow Medal

image.altText: A composite image of the Sydney Swans and Brisbane Lions celebrating making it to the grand final in 2024

props.synopsis: The AFL grand final is happening next weekend. Here's a quick run-down of the basics about the big game.

title.children: What you need to know about the Lions vs Swans AFL grand final

image.altText: NT DV thumb

props.synopsis: A litany of failures by Northern Territory police led to the collapse of an alleged domestic violence case against one of its own detectives.

title.children: 'Gross incompetence': How NT police botched alleged DV case against detective

image.altText: Ben Zygier

props.synopsis: A new documentary aims to shed more light on the case of Prisoner X, who was identified as Australian man Ben Zygier. He'd been working as a spy for Mossad but his alleged crimes remain shrouded in secrecy.

title.children: How the man known as 'Prisoner X' went from suburban Melbourne to the heart of Mossad

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, Narenda Modi, Joe Biden and Fumio Kishida stand in a line next to each other.

props.synopsis: Here's four things Anthony Albanese's trip revealed about the Quad, leadership, language and life lessons.

title.children: Four takeaways from the prime minister's 48 hours in the US for the Quad

image.altText: A concept image for Hobart's Macquarie Point stadium.

props.synopsis: A three-storey, underground car park at Hobart's proposed Macquarie Point AFL stadium is the latest known exclusion from the building cost estimates, a parliamentary hearing is told.

title.children: More items revealed as not being budgeted for in Hobart's proposed stadium costings

image.altText: A notebook with the words "Susan Bartlett Suzanne Armstrong murders of 147 Easey St Collingwood"

props.synopsis: Detectives have been praised for collecting and preserving DNA materials during the original Easey Street investigation at a time when little was known about the use of the science in criminal cases.

title.children: Police investigating the Easey Street killings lauded for using a forensic practice that was yet to prove its worth

image.altText: Devni Vihara posing on a green lawn

props.synopsis: Women of Asian backgrounds reveal they've been told to "not be so ambitious" by earning more money than their partners.

title.children: Devni was told 'not to threaten' her ex-boyfriend's place by earning more money than him

image.altText: A photo of a clock that has a pink and blue background

props.synopsis: Come October 6, Aussies in NSW, VIC, SA, TAS and the ACT will enjoy an extra hour of evening sunlight.

title.children: When does daylight saving start in 2024? Here's what time the clocks go forward and where

image.altText: Moody objects inside a dimly lit home

props.synopsis: Dev spent two nights in a motel before he was placed in a refuge, but with one in two young people getting knocked back from crisis accommodation, he considers himself lucky.

title.children: Dev entered a refuge soon after fleeing abusive home life. He considers himself lucky

image.altText: Ali Brigginshaw of the Broncos passing to her left in an NRLW match

props.synopsis: Brisbane has one hand on a record fifth NRLW minor premiership after coming from behind to thump St George Illawarra 44-14 in Townsville.

title.children: Broncos close in on minor premiership as Knights ensure another finals berth

image.altText: A scrap metal and wire sculpture of a man on a horse that sits on a cliff overlooking bushland.

props.synopsis: Milynda Rogers first started making scrap metal sculptures and putting them by the roadside for school kids to enjoy. Now scores of them adorn the outback landscape.

title.children: The 'scrap metal sheila' turning rusted junk into outback art
